column2: /cname, you demonstrated a firm understanding of the material we covered. You worked hard on all class assignments and it paid off.
column3: You demonstrated understanding of course material and built upon what we learned in class in many interesting ways throughout the course.
column4: You understood and applied all engineering concepts well throughout the course.
column5: The engineering concepts that we discussed in class piqued your interest, and you demonstrated a thorough understanding of the theory as well as its useful applications.

column2: You quickly understood new concepts and began thinking critically about how to apply them to assigned problems, and your own circuit designs.
column3: Despite many projects and assignments being quite difficult, your work was always meticulous and your solutions precise.
column4: The material we covered in class was often initially difficult to understand, but your sustained efforts always led you to fully understand the concepts.

column2: While you sometimes initially struggled with the more difficult concepts, you always thought carefully about problems, and consequently achieved success.
column3: While some concepts in the class required persistence, you always thought carefully about your work, and were able to solve many difficult problems.

column2: On nightly problem assignments, you used concepts from class and our readings to analyze circuits and further understand the finer points of electronics.
column3: You approached our course content thoughtfully. Through collaboration with your peers and your own insights, you were able to apply even the more difficult concepts correctly.
